question:
What does the following statement mean?

Anthropological skills lie not only in understanding other cultures but also in being able to translate them.

answers.text: To “translate” means to be able to understand the meaning and context of what is being studied in a culture.
To “translate” means to be able to understand and to communicate in the language of the culture being studied.
To “translate” means to be able to communicate what is learned across diverse cultures in order for it be shared widely.
To “translate” means being able to observe and assimilate what is being observed in a culture.
